Get Table of Motif Hits

Source: R/methods-PSMatrix.R
ps_hits_table-PSMatrix-method.Rd

Creates a data frame summarizing the motif hits from a `PSMatrix` object, including the motif hit score, position, strand, and corresponding oligo sequence. The resulting table is sorted by motif score (descending). When the score is the same between two sequences, they are sorted by ascending position.

# S4 method for class 'PSMatrix'
ps_hits_table(x, pos_shift = 0L, withDimnames = TRUE)

Arguments

x

An object of class `PSMatrix`. Should contain the following slots:

  • `ps_hits_score`: a numeric vector of hit scores.

  • `ps_hits_strand`: a character vector of strand information (`-` and `+`).

  • `ps_hits_oligo`: a character vector of oligo sequences.

pos_shift

Integer. Value for which the position gets shifted. Default is `0`, meaning no shift.

withDimnames

Logical, whether to include dimension names in the output, if they exist in the object. Default set to `TRUE`.

Value

A `data.frame` ordered by decreasing score value, with the following columns:

  • `SCORE`: the motif hit score

  • `POS`: the position of the motif hit

  • `STRAND`: the strand orientation for each hit

  • `OLIGO`: the oligo sequence corresponding to each hit

Row names correspond to the sequences name.

Examples

pfm1_path <- system.file("extdata", "pfm1.rds", package = "PscanR")
pfm1 <- readRDS(pfm1_path)
ps_hits_table(pfm1)
#>                 SCORE POS STRAND  OLIGO
#> NM_006290.4 1.0000000 123      + CACGTG
#> NM_001877.5 1.0000000 156      + CACGTG
#> NM_003897.4 0.9507672  23      + AACGTG
#> NM_002800.5 0.9507672  89      - CACGTT
#> NM_003998.4 0.8988818 112      + CGCGTG
#> NM_003039.3 0.8988818 244      - CACGCG
#> NM_005429.5 0.8496490 142      - CACGCT
